job_title: Registered Nurse in Bradenton, FL
pros: We have a close knit working group at Point Pleasant. This is one of my favorite places of employment in all of my years of being a nurse 30+ at various specialties. Nearly every single colleague/coworker is very nice with whom to work and say hello as they passby. We have a very kind culture. Human Resources most definitely is the glue which holds together the entire operation. I have never been more impressed with a Director. I am truly Happy to Work Here! Benefits are some of the best if FT or PT. There is 401K for PRN. Westminster is simply a strong company in so many different areas which are important to a candidate when considering a company in which to invest. I feel blessed to be among a good group of people with good morals and ethics.
cons: Often seem to be called upon for what was not done to the exact liking of whomever is in charge on that given day. A spirit of criticism has steadily improved as leadership instead focuses on all that the team does "right" and not only the negative which at times is something rather minor or even trivial. I have noticed more appreciation and recognition directed toward the employees. This is encouraging for morale.

job_title: Management Consultant in Tampa, FL
pros: The only "pro" is if you are a family member of a so-called leader or are someone who will just do whatever they say, even if it's morally or ethically wrong.
cons: Extreme micromanagement like I've never seen before. They put people in positions who are not qualified or even meet the requirements of the job. The only way you will last here is to kiss-up and agree with everything the COO or SVP says. They use their employees. If you fill out a "confidential" employee satisfaction survey, BEWARE as they are not confidential at all. Indicate anything negative about the company leadership and you will be gone even if they have to set you up. They will use problems that you try to inform them of as a way to get rid of you. Most CEO's would have been on to the behaviors of this leadership team long ago but he is too far removed to see it. It will eventually become apparent, all bad things do.

review_title: Not the place where you will be heard
job_title: Dining Services Director in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: The residents are great for the most part
cons: Westminster bills itself as a faith based community that really cares for the residents. They are not that. If it doesn't contribute to the bottom line they will never make a change for the benefit of their residents.

job_title: Director of Volunteers in Bradenton, FL
pros: Great residents to work for, great coworkers who really work together. Work culture very good.
cons: Management not always as transparent as they should be.

job_title: Painter in Tallahassee, FL
pros: The residents are the best part of working here. They appreciate all the work the staff provides. The staff is also friendly. It's a good working environment overall.
cons: I have none to provide here .

review_title: At the time management was changing

review_title: Do your homework, VERY high turnover!

review_title: New to the company but I enjoy it so far

review_title: Administration is trying to do new things and they are hurting the CNAs by not having enough staff for these changes

pros: Excellent benfit package Competetive compensation Beautiful location near downtown Bradenton on the water Lots of opportunities for growth within the organization Work with very knowlegable staff
cons: Staffing has been challenging post covid but it is the same at any other organization in the healthcare industry.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Orlando, FL
pros: Working for a non-profit organization helping low-income seniors in our community
cons: Wages are very low, it’s completely disrespectful.

job_title: Server/Waiter in Orlando, FL
pros: It’s a great work environment and all my co workers are friendly great place to start as my first job
cons: There are no current downsides

job_title: Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: The residents are wonderful and the only enjoyable aspect of this job.
cons: The health center of this facility is poorly run and has been for over a year since my employment. There is an ever-revolving door of ADON's and DON's and administrators. Corporate doesn't have a clue what illegal and unethical staffing this place has. On weekends there will be 1 nurse and 2 aides for 52 patients. For what these residents pay to live here there is absolutely no reason these families should not be up in arms. However, since the nurses are the only people that bother to be present you are the person to be blamed, belittled, and recorded by irate family members. Do yourself a favor and stear clear of this place. Don't believe what they say in your interview because trust me it's been well over a year and countless leaders later and this place is never gonna change.

job_title: Caregiver, CNA in Winter Park, FL
pros: All staff help each other
cons: Want to help more in the future

pros: I love it here the staff and the resident are very friendly and nice

pros: Best reason to work here is the challenging work.

pros: Great coworkers. Genuine people. Organization is always working to improve.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Orlando, FL

job_title: Marketing Assistant in Saint Augustine, FL
pros: The company truly cares about its employees. You aren’t just a number here. Training was good. Very positive environment overall and you have the opportunity to feel like you’re making a difference.
cons: I have nothing negative to say.

pros: Great Place to work and serve older adults

job_title: Server in Saint Augustine, FL

job_title: Resident Life Coordinator in Winter Park, FL
pros: Got to work with the elderly and show off some of my skills. I planned events/outings and had a blast creating events for people who were looking for some fun things that life has to offer.
cons: Working for a company who does not value their employees.

job_title: Sous Chef in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: Great hours and great residents
cons: Upper management tries to micro manage all properties the same.

review_title: Working here gives purpose and hope
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: The residents and most employees are the best people you will ever meet. Working here gives a sense of community and family. Management at community level ranges from ok to excellent. Scholarships for hourly employees can't be beat. 99% of employees at all levels really give their all. Managers use progressive discipline well. Location is beautiful and the food is very affordable and healthy. Real family atmosphere and everyone really cares about each other.
cons: There should be more promoting from within!!!!!! Support from corporate is minimal, I've met the CEO maybe 2 times in passing, and he seems to "rule from afar."  Upper management, particularly in dining and sales do not listen or care to what the community needs and have no concept of hiring managers with existing staff in mind, so they hire with no input from executive director, other managers, or even HR. The technology is poor. Benefits are overpriced with no thought to employees with a poverty level income.

job_title: Server in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
Scholarship
Evening shifts for if you’re in school
cons: Pay and hours were really bad because you end up working almost everyday a week for only 3 hours per day

job_title: Registered Nurse LTC in Julington Creek, FL
pros: Good hearted people work there
cons: Management is stressed and overworked

job_title: Fitness Instructor in Orlando, FL
pros: The residents and team members
cons: understaffed, underpaid but worth it for the residents

job_title: Front Desk Clerk/Security in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Benefits (Health, Dental, Vision, Little life insurance), Employee wellness program, which can be great if stress isn't killing you slowly, and cheesy retirement plans that build at a snail's pace. There's also opportunity to grow like mold on the wall. You won't realize you've wasted so much time loyal to the wrong company, until it's too late.
cons: Blatant discrimination-plantation style, Uneccessary high levels of stress, Micro-Managing, Poor communication, Bad Management, Corporate disregard, Crappy recognition programs (Basically have to be manager's pet or the "right" color to be recognized for hard work, increased skill, and good attitude), Meritless, low retention,  promote conflicts between employees, management, residents, not proactive in resolving issues (everyone potentially becomes a liability at some point whether they intend to or not), just YOU NAME IT!

job_title: Dining Room Supervisor in Winter Park, FL
pros: Benefits are great, exhaustive.  Pay was great, well above average.  Management was great, the best I've ever experienced.  Residents were very friendly and nice.  Beautiful location.  Lots of room for advancement.  This was seriously the best job I've ever had, and I wish I hadn't had to leave it, but I was moving.  Little traffic and easy to get to.  Outstanding in every way.  I feel sad when I think of this place now, because I don't think I'll ever find a job this good again.
cons:
The back-facing facilities were a little old and needed some upgrading, but there was a huge budget, and management wasn't tight-fisted, so that was getting sorted out by the time I left.  

I know people won't believe it when they read this glowing review, but that's honestly the only thing I can think of to complain about.

job_title: Maintenance in Bradenton, FL
pros: The residents are the best reason to work for Westminster.  If you truly open your heart to service them and not just treat this as a job, you get so much joy in your life.  It is hard to lose them but knowing that you had a part of making their final time easy and fun for them, it is a wonderful feeling.  Fellow employees are the next best reason especially if they share the same work ethics and love the residents like you do.  All of us, residents and employees become a very large family.
cons: We are a 24 hour / 365 day facility so holiday work is necessary.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Many of the staff are hard working and provide excellent care for the residents and their families
cons:
Management is terrible. People are being promoted beyond their experience and their ability to do the job is severely lacking.

The pay is low compared to other facilities in the area.

Administration only cares about having a head in a bed. It doesn't matter if they're appropriate for the facility or level of care they need. 

Every department is staffed only the minimum the state requires and doesn't take patient acuity into account.

The executive director, administrator, director of nursing, assistant director of nursing, unit managers, and risk manager have resigned, moved on, or been terminated in the last 2 months.

review_title: Work like a slave and earn penny’s !
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Orlando, FL
pros: Friendly staff!!! Wonderful residents! Food is good! Assisted living and independent living apartments are nice !
cons: 30+ patients to 1 nurse!!!!! Horrible computer system !! Unrealistic workload ! Unsafe ! Extremely LOW pay !!!Extremely expensive medical insurance!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Decent benefits; Opportunities to Transfer to another of 19 communities; fantastic co-workers
cons: Seems to be less resident-oriented than in the past; Corporate speaks about employee appreciation but does not stand behind employees; Corporate office allows local directors to behave as dictators; Part-time staff expected to accomplish full-time goals

job_title: Housekeeper in Jacksonville, FL
pros: All in all this is an amazing place to work. Everyone that I have met so far is very helpful and the residents are so much fun to interact with.
cons: Not happy that employees do not get holiday pay if they work or are scheduled to work.  Also, one of the duties I have should be a responsibility of the residential housekeepers. Finally, do not like the fact that I have to work every weekend. Yes, I knew this prior but, it would be nice if weekends as well as days off during the week could be rotated.

job_title: Director of Sales in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Absolutely phenomenal place to work. They make you feel part of the team the second you start! They put you in a position to succeed and consistently use motivational tactics to keep you going. The upper management show their faces and know your name. Westminster as one big family and they want to see you do well.
cons: They’re interviewing process is long,  But extremely worth it! I would not recommend to anyone with low self discipline, as you will need to hold yourself accountable.

job_title: in Winter Park, FL
pros: Great benefits, I enjoyed working with and for residents. Seemed like you can get promoted if you play your politics right.
cons: Archaic kitchen; building was built in 1960's or 70's all equipment original from then. Kitchen design is counterproductive. Chronic understaffing,lot of forced overtime; confusing menu distribution; floor menus are not what kitchen production is making happens frequently. Cooks have to wash their pots,utensils AND buffet pans, not good at all. Management not supportive at all. overall  just a no fun environment. Would not refer a colleague for a job, ever

review_title: A Great Place to Serve Senior Adults
job_title: Chief Executive Officer in Orlando, FL
pros: If you enjoy being around senior adults, you might love working for Westminster. We are a faith based organization serving over 7,000 senior adults throughout Florida.  We focus on happy lifestyles, good health, choices, and quality homes and services.
cons: We employ and serve imperfect people, so we are not perfect, but we are trying to be, and you can help.

job_title: Director of Design in Orlando, FL
pros: Westminster team members are committed to serving our communities and residents with professionalism, enthusiasm and encouragement.  It is a pleasure to work in such a collaborative atmosphere and be good stewards of our resources.   Suggestions and ideas are heard and implemented, Administrator’s listen and care about residents and families’ experience.
cons: I cannot think of any cons.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Winter Park, FL
pros: Excellent benefits (if you last)
cons: Everyone calls everyone else stupid.  Dietary management whom go around shouting and demeaning employees. Being told by corporate employees that the heralded code of conduct does not apply in Dietary.   After being accused of 'body odor"(?), I just never went back and got another job.

review_title: Great Company that Focuses on the Residents and Staff
job_title: Administrative in Bradenton, FL
pros: Stable company that provides a lot of support to residents and their staff.

job_title: Registered Nurse (RN) in Bradenton, FL
pros: Friendly helpful staff members.  Residents are warm and welcoming.  It is a pleasure to work for such a great facility.
cons: It’s really hard to find any downside of working here.  I really enjoy my job.

job_title: Human Resources Director in Bradenton, FL
pros: Westminster communities offer a variety of beautiful working environments to choose from; an excellent benefit package and wellness program; generous paid time off plan; opportunity for advancement and managers who truly care about their employees.
cons: Point Pleasant is a great place to work!

job_title: Director in Orlando, FL

cons: None, I left for relocation reasons.
